query: Who is the individual associated with the cryptocurrency industry facing a criminal trial on fraud and conspiracy charges, as reported by both The Verge and TechCrunch, and is accused by prosecutors of committing fraud for personal gain?

evidence_list.title: The FTX trial is bigger than Sam Bankman-Fried
evidence_list.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
evidence_list.fact: Before his fall, Bankman-Fried made himself out to be the Good Boy of crypto — the trustworthy face of a sometimes-shady industry.

evidence_list.title: SBF’s trial starts soon, but how did he — and FTX — get here?
evidence_list.author: Jacquelyn Melinek
evidence_list.fact: The highly anticipated criminal trial for Sam Bankman-Fried, former CEO of bankrupt crypto exchange FTX, started Tuesday to determine whether he’s guilty of seven counts of fraud and conspiracy.

evidence_list.title: Sam Altman backs teens’ startup, Google unveils the Pixel 8 and TikTok tests an ad-free tier
evidence_list.author: Kyle Wiggers
evidence_list.fact: The prosecution painted Bankman-Fried as someone who knowingly committed fraud to achieve great wealth, power and influence, while the defense countered that the FTX founder acted in good faith, never meant to commit fraud or steal and basically got in over his head.

query: Which individual is implicated in both inflating the value of a Manhattan apartment to a figure not yet achieved in New York City's real estate history, according to 'Fortune', and is also accused of adjusting this apartment's valuation to compensate for a loss in another asset's worth, as reported by 'The Age'?

evidence_list.title: Donald Trump defrauded banks with 'fantasy' to build his real estate empire, judge rules in a major repudiation against the former president
evidence_list.author: Michael R. Sisak, The Associated Press
evidence_list.fact: No apartment in New York City has ever sold for close to that amount, James said.

evidence_list.title: The $777 million surprise: Donald Trump is getting richer
evidence_list.author: Tom Maloney
evidence_list.fact: The prosecution argues that was to mask a drop in the value of one of his other properties.

query: Who is the figure associated with generative AI technology whose departure from OpenAI was considered shocking according to Fortune, and is also the subject of a prevailing theory suggesting a lack of full truthfulness with the board as reported by TechCrunch?

evidence_list.title: OpenAI's ex-chairman accuses board of going rogue in firing Altman: 'Sam and I are shocked and saddened by what the board did'
evidence_list.author: Matt O'Brien, The Associated Press
evidence_list.fact: Altman’s exit “is indeed shocking as he has been the face of” generative AI technology, said Gartner analyst Arun Chandrasekaran.

evidence_list.title: WTF is going on at OpenAI? We have theories
evidence_list.author: Devin Coldewey
evidence_list.fact: Based on the board’s language and the way these giant tech companies work, this is the prevailing theory floating around right now.

query: Do the TechCrunch article on software companies and the Hacker News article on The Epoch Times both report an increase in revenue related to payment and subscription models, respectively?

evidence_list.title: Here’s how Rainforest, a budding Stripe rival, aims to win over software companies

evidence_list.title: How the conspiracy-fueled Epoch Times went mainstream and made millions
evidence_list.fact: The group reported $76 million in subscription revenue in 2021, compared to nearly $7 million in 2019.
